intro: Megaclinium lutescens, commonly known as the golden clinium, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are usually ovate with a smooth texture, and the flowers are clustered in inflorescences. The golden-yellow color of its blooms makes it a striking addition to botanical gardens and natural habitats.
